Commentator.synopsis: This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.

GameOver.synopsis: The Chase is over, the commentator tells the player to approach her.

Owlbear.synopsis: This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.

Ball.synopsis: This chicken is being used as the 'ball' in a goblin sport. The goblins chase it around an enclosure, trying to make it run between two posts so that they can score a 'goal'. It's exhausted and frightened.

Commentator_12.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_12.text: No more chicken chasin'.  Seems like it's all about the money for some, and I ain't got any to bet.
Commentator_12.context: NodeContext: Sullen, sulking - she bet with you and lost all her money, but she's pretending she only cares about the spirit of the game.

Commentator_19.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_19.text: They done yammerin' on yet? Ain't chicken-chasin' without a bloody crowd.
Commentator_19.context: NodeContext: Impatient, surly - her friends are too busy drinking to play her game.

Commentator_59.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_59.text: Oi! You're not meant to chase it to death. Now you owe me.
Commentator_59.context: NodeContext: Furious - you've ruined their game by killing the ball. Shocked that you could do this and demanding money.

Commentator_150.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_150.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Commentator_196.speaker: Player
Commentator_196.text: I owe you nothing - I didn't kill it.

Commentator_204.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_204.text: You were chasin' it, and now it's dead. Seems clear enough to me - cough up.
Commentator_204.context: NodeContext: As if explaining things to an idiot - you owe her money and she's not letting you away without it.

Commentator_162.speaker: Player
Commentator_162.text: The game's not over. Maybe you can be the next chicken.

Commentator_99.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_99.text: You're bloody mad, you are. Go on then - you're just ruinin' the game anyway.
Commentator_99.context: NodeContext: Shaken, intimidated - still furious at you but knows she can't take you in a fight so opting your spite instead.

Commentator_0.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_0.text: First you ruin the game, then you start makin' threats? Right - lads!
Commentator_0.context: NodeContext: Angry, as if genuinely hurt at how boorish you're being. Tone is 'right, that's it!' and her calling her friends to attack you.

Commentator_184.speaker: Player
Commentator_184.text: My people use goblin slaves for their games. They always die too.

Commentator_77.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_77.text: S-slaves, you say? Right, look - bird's dead, game's over - let's just leave it at that, yeah?
Commentator_77.context: NodeContext: This response is spefically to drow elves, who regularly take her kind as slaves. You've reminded her of this fact and she's trying to back out of the confrontation without antagonising you.

Commentator_186.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_186.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Commentator_178.speaker: Player
Commentator_178.text: Are you trying to extort a True Soul?

Commentator_156.speaker: Player
Commentator_156.text: Are you trying to extort a True Soul?

Commentator_96.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_96.text: Eh... you're a True Soul? All that I said before - just... just forget it.
Commentator_96.context: NodeContext: Licking her lips nervously, realising she's been threatening someone who could effortlessly destroy her. Backtracking, second half of the line making light of the threat she's just made.

Commentator_30.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_30.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Commentator_159.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_159.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Commentator_245.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_245.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Commentator_152.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_152.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

Commentator_26.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_26.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

Commentator_29.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_29.text: Just... just a bit o' fun. No disrespect meant.

Commentator_146.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_146.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

Commentator_289.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_289.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Commentator_154.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_154.context: NodeContext: Snorting derisively - you're trying to convince her of your importance and she's having none of it.

Commentator_266.speaker: Narrator
Commentator_266.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Commentator_69.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_69.text: Bloody pisspots over there. Too busy toastin' when there's real entertainment to be had.

Commentator_25.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_25.text: Not that bloody hollerin'. Clappin' one another on the back as if they've actually done somethin'.
Commentator_25.context: NodeContext: Scornful, disgusted at the behaviour of the other goblins as they get distracted by petty things

Commentator_91.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_91.text: I'm talkin' about somethin' real. I'm talkin' about... chicken-chasin'.
Commentator_91.context: NodeContext: Passionate, fanatic about the game - not at all petty in her eyes.

Commentator_32.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_32.text: Pff, toast. Clappin' themselves on the back as if they've actually done somethin'.
Commentator_32.context: NodeContext: Scornful, disgusted at the behaviour of the other goblins as they get distracted by petty things

Commentator_259.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_259.text: I'd like to see 'em face a real test. Somethin' like... chicken-chasin'.
Commentator_259.context: NodeContext: Passionate, fanatic about the game - not at all petty in her eyes.

Commentator_94.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_94.text: Well? Brave enough to take on the chicken?
Commentator_94.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up, challenging you to prove you're tough enough to play the game.

Commentator_288.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_288.text: Wonderful! And you got coin to back ya? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Commentator_288.context: NodeContext: Delighted to get down to business, assuming you have money to play as a matter of course

Commentator_127.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_127.text: What you chattin' to me for?! Chicken ain't gonna chase itself!
Commentator_127.context: NodeContext: Incredulous, urging you to get into the game.

Commentator_135.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_135.text: Well if it ain't our fledgling chicken-chaser. Got a taste for the game now, do ya?
Commentator_135.context: NodeContext: Considering you. You've earned her respect by playing once before but it was a scam, and she's keen to reel you back in.

Commentator_155.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_155.context: NodeContext: Looking around in anticipation of finding and kill the trespasser - murder being the only game better than chicken chasing

Commentator_161.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_161.text: Well if it ain't our fledgling chicken-chaser. Got a taste for the game now, do ya?
Commentator_161.context: NodeContext: Considering you. You've earned her respect by playing once before but it was a scam, and she's keen to reel you back in.

Commentator_102.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_102.text: Heh! Nothin' like it, is there? C'mon then, you know the drill - coin on the table.
Commentator_102.context: NodeContext: Keen to get down to business

Commentator_247.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_247.text: Bump your head last time or what? Ain't difficult, mate.
Commentator_247.context: NodeContext: Squinting at you - she's already explained the rules to me.

Commentator_202.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_202.text: You face that beastie down one on one. Gotta chase it through the posts before your time's up.
Commentator_202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot showing the game areaNodeContext: Repeating something you should already know

Commentator_133.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_133.text: But most importantly - gotta back yourself with some coin. How much you thinkin'?
Commentator_133.context: NodeContext: Getting to the heart of the matter - the bet.

Commentator_206.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_206.text: Playin' it safe, eh? Ain't a game for the meek, mate.
Commentator_206.context: NodeContext: Chuckling - you're betting a low amount and she's patronising you, assuming you're scared.

Commentator_80.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_80.text: But come on, then - let's get a crowd goin'.
Commentator_80.context: NodeContext: Beckoning you on to follow, keen to start the game.

Commentator_113.speaker: Player
Commentator_113.text: I'm feeling confident. How about a bigger bet? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Commentator_167.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_167.text: It's your money. Let's get a crowd together to watch you lose it, eh?
Commentator_167.context: NodeContext: Delighted at how much you're spending, not about to stop you.

Commentator_182.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_182.text: Then we ain't got nothin' to talk about, do we?

Commentator_124.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_124.text: Mate, we already been through this - no coin, no chase. All right?
Commentator_124.context: NodeContext: Trying to maintain her patience and failing. Last line is a dismissal through gritted teeth.

Commentator_286.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_286.text: You face that chicken down one on one. Gotta chase it through the posts before your time's up.
Commentator_286.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot showing the game areaNodeContext: Repeating something you should already know

Commentator_165.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_165.text: Well, lookie here. Seems like you know your way around the course.
Commentator_165.context: NodeContext: Reassessing you - you've just proven yourself to be quite good at the game and she's patronising you

Commentator_198.speaker: Player
Commentator_198.text: Your rules didn't say anything about fire.

Commentator_273.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_273.text: Well who ever heard o' chicken chase without fire? We're not bloody amateurs.
Commentator_273.context: NodeContext: As if you're just being stupid now. Scornful - you can't play chicken chase without fire, keep up.

Commentator_147.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_147.text: Pardon, your what? Think you misunderstood, mate.
Commentator_147.context: NodeContext: As if you've just said something ridiculous.

Commentator_187.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_187.text: Ain't no winnings, cos only a goblin can win chicken-chase. Says so in the rules.
Commentator_187.context: NodeContext: Shit-eating grin as if she's just played a masterful trick on you. Tone is 'oh, you didn't know?'

Commentator_100.speaker: Player
Commentator_100.text: Rules can be broken. And so can goblin bones.

Commentator_163.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_163.text: Heh. It were only a joke, mate. Here - no quarrel with ya!
Commentator_163.context: NodeContext: Intimidated but trying to save face, as if you're making a big deal of nothing

Commentator_207.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_207.text: What, can't take a joke? Fine, look-
Commentator_207.context: NodeContext: As if you're making a big deal of nothing, going to give your money back

Commentator_115.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_115.text: Wait - s-someone's nicked me coin! You want yours, help me find the bugger.
Commentator_115.context: NodeContext: Alarmed, outraged - she went to give you back your money but has discovered it's gone. And all of hers too, which is what she actually cares about

Commentator_45.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_45.text: Rules are rules, mate. Walk away while you can, eh?
Commentator_45.context: NodeContext: Firm, growing serious. You're pushing your luck and her good humour is fading.

Commentator_109.speaker: Player
Commentator_109.text: You mistook that for a request. My coin - now.

Commentator_264.speaker: Player
Commentator_264.text: We're having fun. Why ruin it now?

Commentator_74.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_74.text: Hmm. All right. No need to get weepy over it, like. Here.
Commentator_74.context: NodeContext: This is a very rare outcome - you've actually found her reason and made her feel bad, but she's petulant and ill-tempered about it.

Commentator_76.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_76.text: Oh, I'm still having fun mate. Keep pushin', though - see what 'appens.
Commentator_76.context: NodeContext: Growing serious - you've told her not to ruin the fun but she's not swayed by your reason, and is growing annoyed at your insistence.

Commentator_250.speaker: Player
Commentator_250.text: You'll be returning my coin - and all of yours.

Commentator_177.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_177.text: You're - you're a True Soul. Here - i-it were only a bit of fun. All yours.
Commentator_177.context: NodeContext: Said with dawning horror - she's just realised she's been messing with someone in a position of authority over her and backs down immediately.

Commentator_122.speaker: Player
Commentator_122.text: You'll be returning my coin - and all of yours.

Commentator_13.speaker: Player
Commentator_13.text: Goblins know to keep a civil tongue in the Underdark. Granted, most of them are slaves.

Commentator_271.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_271.text: The Underdark? Aye, I've, uh - I've 'ad litter-mates disappear down there.
Commentator_271.context: NodeContext: Feigning interest but growing nervous - you've reminded her that your species are natural predators to hers, and she's becoming afraid.

Commentator_230.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_230.text: Heh. Here, your coin - were only a joke! Heh, rules.
Commentator_230.context: NodeContext: Handing back your money as if she was just making a joke.

Commentator_103.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_103.text: S-slaves? Look, I don't want no trouble. Just take your coin, and -
Commentator_103.context: NodeContext: Growing nervous. You've just reminded her that your people enslave her kind and she's afraid she's offended you.

Commentator_123.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_123.text: A joke, is all. No offence meant.
Commentator_123.context: NodeContext: Still babbling nervously, hoping you'll leave.

Commentator_218.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_218.text: Wait, it's bloody gone. Where the -
Commentator_218.context: NodeContext: Alarmed, panicked - you frightened her into returning your money, but someone else has stolen it in the meantime.

Commentator_40.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_40.text: Look - already lost me coin, ain't lookin' to lose anything else. Let's just leave it there, eh?
Commentator_40.context: NodeContext: Wheedling, as if talking to someone on the verge of violence.

Commentator_265.speaker: Player
Commentator_265.text: You rigged the game. I want my money back.

Commentator_269.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_269.text: Do you now? Or what - gonna cry?
Commentator_269.context: NodeContext: Snorting, unimpressed by your bravado

Commentator_180.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_180.text: Well now - you look like a tough'un. But 'ave you got smarts? Skill? Guts?
Commentator_180.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up as you approach. She's very passionate about this sport, and is challenging you to see if you're worthy.

Commentator_243.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_243.text: And you're gonna need it, mate. This ain't your standard dungeon-dive, right. This...
Commentator_243.context: NodeContext: You've just proclaimed your toughness, but she's absolutely certain you haven't faced anything like what she's about to describe.

Commentator_174.speaker: Player
Commentator_174.text: I can handle myself just fine.

Commentator_283.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_283.text: No doubt, mate. But this ain't dragons, or demons, or anything else you might've faced. This...
Commentator_283.context: NodeContext: Indulgent - she doesn't doubt your achievements, but they're kids stuff compared to what she's about to detail to you.

Commentator_236.speaker: Player
Commentator_236.text: If you have a point, why don't you just get to it?

Commentator_141.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_141.text: Don't hang about, do ya? Maybe that serves you well, out fightin' beasties. But this ain't that. This...
Commentator_141.context: NodeContext: Considering, impressed at your tenacity. Second line is somewhat patronising - maybe that temper impresses other people, but not her.

Commentator_98.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_98.context: NodeContext: Low, intense, excited - as if announcing something grand.

Commentator_3.speaker: Player
Commentator_3.text: Well, for starters - that's no chicken. It's an owlbear.

Commentator_23.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_23.text: Besides, I reckon it owes us seein' as how it just ate our last chicken.

Commentator_275.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_275.text: Reckon it owes us a game. You wanna hear the rules or not?

Commentator_72.speaker: Player
Commentator_72.text: Could be fun. What is chicken-chasing, exactly?

Commentator_263.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_263.text: Only the greatest game since eggs sprouted legs, mate.
Commentator_263.context: NodeContext: Playing it up, excited to share this with you.

Commentator_224.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_224.text: You just gotta chase the chicken around the course and through the posts - but that ain't all.
Commentator_224.context: CinematicNodeContext: SHOULD ZOOM OVER TO LOCATION IN QUESTIONNodeContext: As if describing something simple - with a catch.

Commentator_195.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_195.text: Gotta do it quick, and alone - any of your mates step in, you lose. Time runs out, you lose.
Commentator_195.context: NodeContext: Intense - rattling off all the conditions in which you can fail.

Commentator_140.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_140.text: Sound easy? It ain't. Come back once those boozehounds are done toastin' - you'll see.
Commentator_140.context: NodeContext: 'Sound easy' is patronising, as if you're already underestimating the task. Rest of line is deadly serious. She's petulant that she can't proceed until her friends are done drinking.

Commentator_284.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_284.text: Sound easy? It ain't. Come back when that half-wit's done wailin' and find out.
Commentator_284.context: NodeContext: 'Sound easy' is patronising, as if you're already underestimating the task. Rest of line is deadly serious. She's petulant that she can't proceed until her friends are done listening to a nearby singer.

Commentator_112.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_112.text: Sound easy? It ain't. Better contenders than you have been bested by the bird.
Commentator_112.context: NodeContext: 'Sound easy' is patronising, as if you're already underestimating the task. Rest of line is deadly serious. She's petulant that she can't proceed until her friends are done drinking.

Commentator_15.speaker: Player
Commentator_15.text: You know that's an owlbear, right?

Commentator_267.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_267.text: It's got feathers, don't it? A beak?
Commentator_267.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, disgusted that you're getting bogged down in all the wrong details when there's a game to be played. An owlbear is a savage beast many times larger than a human, let alone the chicken they usually play with.

Commentator_93.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_93.text: Besides, I reckon it owes us seein' as how it just ate our last chicken.
Commentator_93.context: NodeContext: Saying it's only fair that the owlbear take part because it ate the chicken they usually use.

Commentator_82.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_82.text: Now you wanna play, or is there a bit o' chicken in you and all?
Commentator_82.context: NodeContext: Not to be distracted, getting back to the main point. Convinced you're only asking so many questions because you're afraid to play.

Commentator_188.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_188.text: Ohoho. Fancy yourself, do ya? Care to pin that claim down with some coin? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Commentator_189.speaker: Player
Commentator_189.text: Oh, come on. Let's make a real wager. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Commentator_256.speaker: Player
Commentator_256.text: I have no desire to gamble.

Commentator_181.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_181.text: Then you don't want to play. This game ain't for rattle-guts that don't believe in theirselves.
Commentator_181.context: NodeContext: Very serious, not to be swayed on this point - if you don't pay, you don't play.

Commentator_222.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_222.text: We got the coin, we got the challenger - now we just need a crowd, eh?
Commentator_222.context: NodeContext: Getting excited about playing, ready to call everyone over.

Commentator_143.speaker: Player
Commentator_143.text: If we're going to bet, we may as well go all in. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Commentator_55.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_55.text: Cocky, eh? Maybe you've got the skill to back it up. Or maybe I'm about to make a heap o' coin.
Commentator_55.context: NodeContext: Impressed by your confidence, eager to take your money.

Commentator_129.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_129.text: Let's get a crowd goin' and find out, eh?
Commentator_129.context: NodeContext: Said with a wink - she's excited and anticipating the game.

Commentator_114.speaker: Player
Commentator_114.text: I don't have the gold for it.

Commentator_107.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_107.text: Then go waste some other bugger's time, eh?
Commentator_107.context: NodeContext: Irritated, as if making a fake-polite suggestion

Commentator_81.speaker: Player
Commentator_81.text: I'm not playing your 'game'. It's barbaric.

Commentator_208.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_208.text: No skin off my arse. Just remember you 'ad the chance to be part o' something grand - and you walked away.
Commentator_208.context: NodeContext: Affront and vague disgust for our lack of dedication - we've just refused to play what she considers the greatest game of all time.

Commentator_185.speaker: Player
Commentator_185.text: I'm leaving - and the owlbear's coming with me.

Commentator_158.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_158.text: Is ya, now? Reckon I feel differently. Reckon the lads will, too.
Commentator_158.context: NodeContext: Eyebrows raised - as if being threatened by a child. You're making bold claims she's pretty confident you can't back up.

Commentator_281.speaker: Player
Commentator_281.text: You love this game enough to die over it?

Commentator_241.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_241.text: Might do. Don't plan on being the dead'un, though - lads!
Commentator_241.context: NodeContext: Placid, utterly unconcerned by your threats and calling her friends to help kill you.

Commentator_110.speaker: Player
Commentator_110.text: Feel differently? How about you feel dead?

Commentator_49.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_49.text: Hells, fine - just take the fat bird, if it means that much to ya. We'll find another chicken.
Commentator_49.context: NodeContext: Preceded by a sigh. As if you're making a big deal over something small and she's indulging you, when really you've intimidated her.

Commentator_18.speaker: Player
Commentator_18.text: I'd be doing you a favour. The beast will only get bigger - and tougher.

Commentator_6.speaker: Player
Commentator_6.text: I'd be doing you a favour. Keeping such a large beast fed isn't easy.

Commentator_20.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_20.text: Hmm. Bugger did eat our last chicken.
Commentator_20.context: NodeContext: Considering. She hasn't fully thought through how much trouble keeping this owlbear creature might be and you've convinced her to hand it over.

Commentator_248.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_248.text: Right, go on then - fat bird's yours. Don't need the hassle.
Commentator_248.context: NodeContext: Throwing up her hands, not interested in the complication.

Commentator_233.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_233.text: I'll do you a favour, and pretend you ain't trying to steal my chicken.
Commentator_233.context: NodeContext: Suddenly cold, no longer humouring whatever joke you're making. Very clearly done with you.

Commentator_270.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_270.text: Now bugger off - if you ain't playin' you're just wastin' my time.
Commentator_270.context: NodeContext: Dismissing you - you've taken up enough of her time and you're not even interested in her beloved game.

Commentator_136.speaker: Player
Commentator_136.text: I'm saying I want to buy it.

Commentator_111.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_111.text: Do ya now? And who says you can afford it, eh? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_5_8860ed48-ba5f-4b7b-82bf-f1220f967d41])
Commentator_111.context: NodeContext: Arched eyebrow, tone is 'oh really?' She's surprised by and suspicous of your offer to buy the owlbear.

Commentator_166.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_166.text: Suit yourself. We'll just buy a new chicken. A normal one, not this big fat lump.
Commentator_166.context: NodeContext: Pretending to be unconcerned, but delighted at the money she just made. Bemused by what a big deal you were making over this animal's safety.

Commentator_27.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_27.text: You keep wasting my time, you're gonna have more than coin to worry about.
Commentator_27.context: NodeContext: Impatient, threatening - implying you stand to lose a lot more than your money if you keep bothering.

Commentator_193.speaker: Player
Commentator_193.text: That's a bit steep for me.

Commentator_5.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_5.text: You're gonna pay with somethin' else, you keep wastin' my time like this.
Commentator_5.context: NodeContext: Impatient, threatening - implying you stand to lose a lot more than your money if you keep bothering.

Commentator_117.speaker: Player
Commentator_117.text: Actually, keep it. It's all yours.

Commentator_14.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_14.text: That weren't even in question, mate.
Commentator_14.context: NodeContext: Snorting with derision - you're trying to save face but she's confident you're not a threat.

Commentator_105.speaker: Player
Commentator_105.text: I don't care what you think. I'm not asking.

Commentator_260.speaker: Player
Commentator_260.text: I don't care what you think. I'm not asking.

Commentator_116.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_116.text: You're a... you're a True Soul?
Commentator_116.context: NodeContext: With dawning horror - she's been taking an aggressive tone with you and she's just realised you're a figure many ranks above her in the hierarchy.

Commentator_84.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_84.text: B-beg pardon. Please, take it. A gift! Reckon it's too fat to run anyway, heh.
Commentator_84.context: NodeContext: Scared, trying to save her own skin by showing utter capitulation.  Last line is a nervous joke.

Commentator_183.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_183.text: Oi! Whatever it is you're doin', you can bloody well stop it.
Commentator_183.context: NodeContext: Confused but furious, about to attack you. You've tried to influence her thoughts but she's managed to shake free.

Commentator_85.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_85.text: Fun? Show a bit of respect, mate. This is serious business.
Commentator_85.context: NodeContext: She takes this game very seriously

Commentator_1.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_1.text: Business we can't be about 'til them fools are done with their speechin'.
Commentator_1.context: NodeContext: Gesturing over at her friends with disgust - they're too busy drinking to play.

Commentator_86.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_86.text: Business we can't be about 'til that half-wit's done wailin'.
Commentator_86.context: NodeContext: Gesturing over at her friends with disgust - they're too busy listening to a singer to play

Commentator_190.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_190.text: Besides - we gotta agree stakes before we begin, don't we? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Commentator_190.context: NodeContext: Pulling you back, explaining you need to place a bet before you can play. As if this should be obvious.

Commentator_37.speaker: Player
Commentator_37.text: This is cruel. I won't be part of it.

Commentator_60.speaker: Player
Commentator_60.text: I have better things to do than chase poultry.

Commentator_131.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_131.text: Oh c'mon now, don't be scared. It's a simple game - that's what makes it beautiful.
Commentator_131.context: NodeContext: Patronising - the only reason she can imagine someone wouldn't want to play if that they're afraid.

Commentator_144.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_144.text: You just gotta chase the chicken through the course to the posts there, right?
Commentator_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: SHOULD ZOOM OVER TO LOCATION IN QUESTIONNodeContext: As if describing something simple - with a catch.

Commentator_119.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_119.text: Gotta do it fast, and gotta do it alone. Any of your mates step in, you lose. Time runs out, you lose.
Commentator_119.context: NodeContext: Intense - rattling off all the conditions in which you can fail.

Commentator_280.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_280.text: Simple, see? But not easy, no. Come back when them fools are done speechin' - you'll see.
Commentator_280.context: NodeContext: Bright and cheery, but warning you not to be overconfident. Annoyed you can't play until the singer everyone is distracted by has gone away.

Commentator_51.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_51.text: Simple, see? But not easy, no. Come back when that half-wit's done wailin' and find out.
Commentator_51.context: NodeContext: Bright and cheery, but warning you not to be overconfident. Annoyed you can't play until the singer everyone is distracted by has gone away.

Commentator_157.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_157.text: Simple, like I say - but not easy. Better contenders than you have been bested by that bird.
Commentator_157.context: NodeContext: Bright and cheery, but warning you not to be overconfident

Commentator_191.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_191.text: All right, all right. Take your money.
Commentator_191.context: NodeContext: A bad loser - you've just beaten her fair and square.

Commentator_168.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_168.text: I'd almost swear you're in league with the bloody beast.
Commentator_168.context: NodeContext: Suspicious at how well you're playing the game.

Commentator_258.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_258.text: I swear, I nearly think you're in league with that bloody chicken.
Commentator_258.context: NodeContext: Suspicious at how well you're playing the game.

Commentator_200.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_200.text: Well lookee! That thing works even better'n a chicken. Reckon we won't eat it after all.
Commentator_200.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

Commentator_210.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_210.text: Eh, no more games today, True Soul. We ain't worthy, what with the Absolute on your side and all.
Commentator_210.context: NodeContext: Nervous, shifty. Explaining in a whiney fashion that they're not playing the game any more - mainly cos they're too frightened of you.

Commentator_38.speaker: Player
Commentator_38.text: I'll be taking the owlbear too.

Commentator_217.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_217.text: Oof. Hard luck, mate. Told you it weren't as easy as it looked.
Commentator_217.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

Commentator_192.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_192.text: That's the spirit! Now show me the coin.
Commentator_192.context: InternalNodeContext: Checking the bet because jumping to the betting nodes which can be shown to the players during the game alsoNodeContext: Loud, encouraging - but more eager to see your money.

Commentator_11.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_11.context: NodeContext: Excited, shouting to the whole field

Commentator_257.speaker: Player
Commentator_257.text: I like my chances. I'll bet more. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Commentator_39.speaker: Player
Commentator_39.text: On second thought, I'm done playing.

Commentator_223.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_223.text: You got your money, right? Don't want no trouble.
Commentator_223.context: NodeContext: Afraid but trying to reason with you, doesn't want any more hassle from you.

Commentator_228.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_228.text: Bloody bard. Used to be goblins had taste.
Commentator_228.context: NodeContext: Disgusted at how far her people have fallen. They used to love the sport she loves.

Commentator_232.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_232.text: What? Ain't nothin' left to chase, unless you fancy volunteerin'.
Commentator_232.context: NodeContext: Bored, surly - for one reason or another she can't play the game any more, and there's a dull hostility to her.

Commentator_246.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_246.text: What? Ain't nothin' left to chase, unless you fancy volunteerin'.
Commentator_246.context: NodeContext: Bored, surly - for one reason or another she can't play the game any more, and there's a dull hostility to her.

Commentator_262.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_262.text: Hells, that yowlin' bleeds the ears. Is that supposed to be entertainment?
Commentator_262.context: InternalNodeContext: Only with Chicken, owlbear has higher priority than a human bardNodeContext: Preoccupied, gesturing with disgust at the singing bard.

Commentator_87.speaker: Player
Commentator_87.text: I suppose you could do much better.

Commentator_173.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_173.text: Don't need to, mate. We already got the greatest art there is - and it ain't no warbling.
Commentator_173.context: NodeContext: Sullen, scornful - her game is obviously better, and only an idiot would think otherwise.

Commentator_75.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_75.context: NodeContext: Said with intensity, as if you should already know and be impressed by the game

Commentator_219.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_219.text: He's a distraction. Don't get me wrong - it's funny pokin' 'im and watchin' 'im holler.
Commentator_219.context: NodeContext: Dismissive of the bard - allowing that being cruel to him is always entertaining, but not as entertaining as her favourite game.

Commentator_97.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_97.text: But we got serious business to be about 'ere. Chicken-chasin'.
Commentator_97.context: NodeContext: Intense, very serious about the game.

Commentator_276.speaker: Krolla
Commentator_276.text: Brave enough to take on our new chicken? It's a big'un, but that's just more for the chasin'.
Commentator_276.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up, challenging you to prove you're tough enough to play the game.

Owlbear_9.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_9.text: *The cub breathes in shallow bursts, his chest heaving with the effort.*

Owlbear_12.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only

Owlbear_34.speaker: Player
Owlbear_34.text: Kneel down - you won't hurt him.

Owlbear_41.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_41.text: *You notice a shiver run through his feathered coat - fear, a desperate longing for the safety of his nest.*

Owlbear_35.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_35.text: *But his mother is gone - taken. All that's left are these creatures.*

Owlbear_3.speaker: Player
Owlbear_3.text: Offer him your hand. He can follow your scent to your camp in the wilderness.

Owlbear_37.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tilts his head and regards the player.NodeContext: SwA line He's considering trusting the player.

Owlbear_50.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_50.text: Got to get away from here first.

Owlbear_15.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_15.text: *The cub seems anxious to leave, but afraid to defy the goblins. They have to be dealt with, one way or another.*
Owlbear_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks around, hooting anxiously. Not safe to leave yet.InternalNodeContext: The cub looks around, hooting anxiously. Not safe to leave yet.

Owlbear_79.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_79.text: *The cub tilts his head. He's considering it.*

Owlbear_44.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_44.text: *He runs away. Only time will tell if he'll reappear.*
Owlbear_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub backs away and leaves.

Owlbear_48.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub tilts head, considering player, then backs away and leaves.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record.

Owlbear_77.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_77.context: NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Owlbear_18.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_18.text: *The cub looks at you with dulled eyes. He longs for home.*

Owlbear_20.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angry.NodeContext: SFX only - Angry

Owlbear_19.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_19.text: *... it's furious. Rage blazes within it. Tear. Hunt. Kill.*

Owlbear_60.speaker: Player
Owlbear_60.text: Coax the cub toward the goalposts.

Owlbear_16.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_16.text: *The owlbear coos softly. He doesn't understand - but he trusts you.*
Owlbear_16.context: NodeContext: The player has freed the owlbear. It is tentatively following the player but is prepared to attack should it be provoked.

Owlbear_6.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_6.text: *The cub's feathers ruffle in distrust. With a defiant squawk, he bounds away.*

Owlbear_13.speaker: Player
Owlbear_13.text: Guide his gaze to the goblins - they deserve to die.

Owlbear_29.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_29.text: *The cub's beak snaps in the air, eager to rend, yearning for blood and soft belly-flesh.*
Owlbear_29.context: NodeContext: The owlbear is furious and about to erupt in a killing spree.

Owlbear_63.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_63.text: *The cub clicks his beak weakly - more scared than afraid. He has no fight left in him.*
Owlbear_63.context: NodeContext: The owlbear doesn't trust the player and is warding it off.

Owlbear_5.speaker: Player
Owlbear_5.text: Nod to the goalposts - he'll be safe there.

Owlbear_70.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_70.text: *Its talons bite deep into the earth, every muscle trembling. You realise it isn't afraid...*

Owlbear_27.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_27.context: NodeContext: As in: "Go away! I'll bite you! I'll really do it!"

Owlbear_28.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only - Exasperated/On-Edge

Owlbear_31.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear_31.text: *Talons tensed to strike, beak aching to rend - the cub wants you gone.*
Owlbear_31.context: NodeContext: The cub no longer trusts the player and wants him gone. A threat.

Owlbear_36.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_36.context: NodeContext: As in: "I have to run! They'll get me!"

Owlbear_46.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_46.context: NodeContext: As in: "Mommy's gone. I'm hungry!"

Owlbear_78.speaker: Player
Owlbear_78.text: I have a camp. You're welcome there.

Owlbear_55.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angry.NodeContext: SFX only. Angry.

Owlbear_73.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_73.context: NodeContext: As in: "The goblins are going to hurt me. I have to run! Where can I run?!"

Owlbear_2.speaker: Player
Owlbear_2.text: See those posts? Run toward them.

Owlbear_85.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_85.context: NodeContext: As in: "It'll be safe there? I have to run!"

Owlbear_26.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_26.context: NodeContext: As in: "No! They'll hurt me! I have to run!"

Owlbear_61.speaker: Player
Owlbear_61.text: The goblins are responsible for your pain. Kill them.

Owlbear_10.speaker: Player
Owlbear_10.text: The goblins tried to hurt you. Show them what hurt really means.

Owlbear_65.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_65.context: NodeContext: As in: "I'm going to kill them!"

Owlbear_40.speaker: Player
Owlbear_40.text: They won't hurt you if you run to those posts.

Owlbear_74.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear_74.context: NodeContext: As in: "I want to go home to my cave, to my mother."

Ball_7.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_7.context: NodeContext: The chicken is terrified. She's being chased by goblins and fears she will be eaten.

Ball_20.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_20.context: NodeContext: Appealing directly to the player for help. Hoping anyone will save her.

Ball_10.speaker: Player
Ball_10.text: Wild things do not beg for help. They protect themselves.

Ball_28.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_28.text: No. Too many goblins. Too many dead before me!
Ball_28.context: NodeContext: Terrified. Player has suggested she attack the goblins but she's too afraid and too upset - she's seen them kill other chickens right before her eyes

Ball_6.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_6.text: Yes! Bite and claw and tear and bite!
Ball_6.context: NodeContext: Desperately angry and afraid - but determind to attack the goblins and peck their eyes out.

Ball_19.speaker: Player
Ball_19.text: You are a noble fowl. Fast. Sharp. VENGEFUL!

Ball_5.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_5.text: Tired. Frightened. A game to the featherless ones - but not a game! Not a game!

Ball_29.speaker: Player
Ball_29.text: I'll help. Just run through the posts, and you'll be free.

Ball_18.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_18.context: NodeContext: Player has told her of a way to get out. Can't quite believe she might escape. Afraid but hopeful.

Ball_8.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_8.context: NodeContext: Player has been cruel to her. Player was her one chance at safety and its been take away from her - she's in despair

Ball_27.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_27.text: Tired. Lie down. But don't want to burn.
Ball_27.context: NodeContext: The chicken has been running from her captors for a long time. She's terrified but exhausted and doesn't know how much longer she can keep going.

Ball_34.speaker: Player
Ball_34.text: You'll be free just as soon as you run through the posts.

Ball_33.speaker: Dishevelled Chicken
Ball_33.context: NodeContext: The chicken is trying to flee the goblins that chase her. She's panicked and looking for an exit.

Ball_12.speaker: Narrator
Ball_12.text: *The chicken's head bobs, eyes darting around at the leering goblin faces. She's terrified.*
Ball_12.context: NodeContext: Appealing directly to the player for help. Hoping anyone will save her.

Ball_31.speaker: Narrator
Ball_31.text: *She shrinks from your voice - just another leering face sent to torment her.*
Ball_31.context: NodeContext: Terrified. Player has suggested she attack the goblins but she's too afraid and too upset.

Ball_2.speaker: Narrator
Ball_2.text: *She meets your eye, and the fear there hardens into rage. She gathers herself.*
Ball_2.context: NodeContext: Desperately angry and afraid - but determind to attack the goblins and peck their eyes out.

Ball_26.speaker: Narrator
Ball_26.text: *She shies away in fear, not understanding.*
